intro: Diplotaxis brochmannii, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features erect, branching stems and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Diplotaxis brochmannii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
